meanings.definition: Make a low, continuous humming sound.
meanings.sent1: The bees were buzzing around the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The old refrigerator was buzzing loudly in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was buzzing with the sound of students chatting.
meanings.sent4: The city was buzzing with life and activity even late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The summer air was buzzing with the sound of cicadas in the trees.

meanings.definition: A feeling of excitement or energy.
meanings.sent1: The children were buzzing with anticipation before the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The stadium was buzzing with cheers as the home team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The office was buzzing with excitement about the upcoming team-building event.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was buzzing with joy when she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere was buzzing with energy during the music concert.

meanings.sent1: She received a buzzing from her friend about the movie night.
meanings.sent2: I missed the buzzing from my mom while I was in a meeting.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing from her boss made her nervous about the upcoming presentation.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing from the group chat kept her updated on the weekend plans.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing from the voicemail indicated an important message waiting for her.

meanings.definition: A state of being busy or active.
meanings.sent1: The office was buzzing with employees preparing for the big meeting.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was buzzing with activity as they prepared dinner for the guests.
meanings.sent3: The park was buzzing with families enjoying the sunny weekend.
meanings.sent4: The city center was buzzing with shoppers during the holiday season.
meanings.sent5: The school was buzzing with students rushing to finish their assignments before the bell rang.
